metadata.title: CVE-2017-3143 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An attacker who is able to send and receive messages to an authoritativeDNS server and who has knowledge of a valid TSIG key name for the zone andservice being targeted may be able to manipulate BIND into accepting anunauthorized dynamic update. Affects BIND 9.4.0->9.8.8, 9.9.0->9.9.10-P1,9.10.0->9.10.5-P1, 9.11.0->9.11.1-P1, 9.9.3-S1->9.9.10-S2,9.10.5-S1->9.10.5-S2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3143` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7
bind9-host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7
bind9utils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7
dnsutils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7
host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7
libbind9-140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7
libdns-export162 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7
libdns162 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7
libirs-export141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7
libirs141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7
libisc-export160 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7
libisc160 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7
libisccc-export140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7
libisccc140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7
libisccfg-export140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7
libisccfg140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7
liblwres141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7
lwresd - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.7').
